result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Alexander Lange was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 22CM3205, with credit for 96 DAYS time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Alexander Lange

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and upon the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in cases 22CM359 & 21CM3205.

Sentencing hearing proceded with case 21CM3205 with statements from state, defense counsel and defendant. 

The Court ordered the defendant to:

As to 21CM3205:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to 22CM359, with credit for 117 DAYS time served.

As to 22CM359:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to 21CM3205, with credit for 96 DAYS time served.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 30 DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction, imposed and stayed for use at the agents discretion as to 22CM359.
- No use or possession of alcohol. 
- No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment.
- No contact with IRC, HRG and GJG.
- Anger Management Class.

- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 07/11/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
- Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN.
& ADDENDUM, filed.
Elements of the Offense, filed.
State's Offer Letter, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Cody Alexander Lange not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings. 
Defense advises the Court a global offer is being discussed with defendant's other pending matters but requests a plea and sentencing date.
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain. ($750.00 ADDITIONAL).
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody Alexander Lange appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Justice Point Discharge Report, filed.
Defendant is in bench warrant status. Court takes no further action at this time.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($250.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Pretrial conference. Defense has not made contact with his client. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Cody Alexander Lange not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  
Case in court for status conference.  Defendant's appearanceis waived. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

22RM016158  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
3/23/2022
Justice Point Violation (Missed Office Contact) Report received and filed.
Forwarded for signature.

Court ordered no contact with HRG (DOB 02/15/1966) and GJG (DOB 12/22/1971)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody Alexander Lange appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests status date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Gary Rosenthal received and filed
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cody Alexander Lange in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody Alexander Lange appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
